awd_abstract_narration:
The broader impact/commercial potential of this I-Corps project is the development of a face mask design that may positively impact multiple economic sectors and better the lives of about 14.4 million workers in the United States. These workers are employed in occupations where exposure to disease or infection occurs at least once per week. The need for improved and more comfortable respirators includes healthcare providers, firefighters, military medical personnel, and everyday citizens. 

This I-Corps project is based on the development of new masks to prevent exposure to disease and infection. The mask leverages electrohydrodynamic technology to create a novel air pressurizing device that surpasses other personal protection equipment in terms of size, weight, and comfortability, while maintaining a high filtration efficiency. The unique advantage of this design is that the mask filters out all particles in both exhaling and inhaling cycles without touching the skin of the wearer’s face. The filtering action takes place along the entire perimeter of the mask, a few millimeters away from the face. Particles and droplets present in the air are removed with electrostatic forces. A comfortable headband keeps the mask in place, and it matches the comfort of a well-fitted bicycle helmet. Since the innovation is designed to avoid contact with the wearer’s face, it eliminates bruising while feeling lighter (at about 454 grams). This technology has been shown to be more comfortable to wear than other personal protection equipment. With the addition of a clear face shield, this mask does not obstruct the face of the wearer and those who are hearing impaired can communicate through lip reading. Furthermore, the mask can be sterilized and is reusable, so as to reduce environmental waste. The successful adoption of the mask will improve lives across a variety of different sectors, including healthcare, and transportation.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships

por.por_cntn:
The NSF I-Corps project was to further develop a ground-breaking personal protection equipment (PPE) called the Surface Ionization Noncontact Extended-Wear (SINEW) Mask, which utilizes electrohydrodynamic (EHD) technology for enhanced air filtration. Through the development of a customer discovery driven startup process at CATCH, Georion identified how they could take their unique technology from bench to bedside and bring it out into the market. Intellectual Merit: The SINEW Mask is a substantial improvement compared to existing air filtration technologies. The SINEW Mask leverages eletrohydrodynamic principles in a way that allows for near-contactless air filtration—meaning the mask doesn't even need to touch your face. This improves comfort, and also offers a re-usable solution to disposable PPE, killing two birds with one stone when it comes efficacy as well sustainability. The intellectual merit of the project is that if successful, it will transform personal protective equipment to be both more efficacious and user-friendly — a necessity in health care or first responder settings. The project also recorded several achievements, having attained over 150 customer discovery interviews that informed the development of product-market fit and understanding user demand. These interviews would drive the creation of a business model, and also prove to potential partners that this technology was more than theoretical through them seeing exciting demonstrations. Broader Impacts:The broader impacts of the SINEW Mask project operate beyond pure scientific and technological domains. The results of the initiative could potentially revolutionize public health and safety with a PPE they can wear more comfortably, correctly. By solving the issue of discomfort that is so widely experienced in existing products, it increases compliance which will likely be fundamental to how effective masks can realistically become at a population level over time.

In addition, SINEW reusable Mask brings sustainability to help prevent waste with single-use masks. The project contributes not only to the development of PPE but also supports sustainability with a more positive approach in line with global waste reduction and conservation efforts. The societal impact of the SINEW Mask project can affect public policies and behaviour in terms of PPE use across sectors such as healthcare, emergency services or broader at large within public spaces. If PPE is a more user-friendly and accessible (sustainable) option, we should see greater use of these tools globally for better public health. 

SINEW Mask prototype ready for in-house testing The device has seen some great improvements, with a more user-friendly interface and the ability to be customized - perfect for deployment in all kinds of industries. Market Validation — Product/Market Fit Validated, Customer Segments And Value Propositions Defined Through Extensive Customer Discovery As a result of this validation, the company has been given an official "go" decision to set up a for-profit startup business that will take the technology to market. The organization has created opportunities for students and researchers to develop professionally, which encourages the spirit of entrepreneurship in team members making this project as a practice round preparing them when they move forward into business competitions or grant applications. A number of companies have shown interest in the SINEW Mask and the project team is considering possible avenues for technology transfer, as well as commercialization.

The SINEW Mask project has made radical headway in the development and commercialization of air filtration technology. Such an accomplishment will result in benefits to public health, environmental sustainability and the field of personal protective equipment as a whole. With further development and efforts on commercialization, the SINEW Mask might become an essential force in creating better public safety and environmental responsibility.

 


Last Modified: 08/24/2024
Modified by: Alexander V Mamishev

The SINEW Mask leverages eletrohydrodynamic principles in a way that allows for near-contactless air filtrationmeaning the mask doesn't even need to touch your face. In addition, SINEW reusable Mask brings sustainability to help prevent waste with single-use masks. With further development and efforts on commercialization, the SINEW Mask might become an essential force in creating better public safety and environmental responsibility.
